page.title: 17TOWN-CENTRE HOUSING, PRESTON
page.content: As{Preston town centre}has expanded the housing in our area has changed. Rows of terraced houses were built for all the workers who came to work in Preston's factories. As the original housing{deteriorated some of it was knocked down.Tower blocks, maisonettes and low-level flats were built. Old people who had to leave their houses had special sheltered housing built in the area. Rich{Georgians and Victorians}built large houses close to the River Ribble and parks. Many of these are now used as offices. A large inter_wars estate was built near the river. To keep people in the town-centre{new housing}has replaced some old streets. Around{Frenchwood {School}many houses are being{repaired. Many of our houses date from 1909. We hope they will still be here in 2009.
